author: MassimoSt
post_text: March 21, 2020 at 11:04 AM#1Hello everybody,Is it possible to copy a macro in another macro?now I have to write all the lines from macro 1 in macro 2.maybe someone can help me?Thank you!

posts.author: MassimoSt
posts.post_text: March 21, 2020 at 11:04 AM#1Hello everybody,Is it possible to copy a macro in another macro?now I have to write all the lines from macro 1 in macro 2.maybe someone can help me?Thank you!

posts.author: F Dijkers
posts.post_text: March 21, 2020 at 12:03 PM#2Hi,This works a bit different then you're explaining right now. You just can refer to another macro within your macro. Just put in "Macro x.y", where y can be the line if you want to.Kind regards,Floris DijkersLighting Director & Designerflorisdijkers.comlighting@florisdijkers.com

posts.author: Duplicate MarkvanderMeulen
posts.post_text: March 21, 2020 at 5:59 PM#3Just copy the macro: copy macro 1 at macro 2, when you need the complete macro in the new macroOr some specific lines: copy 1.x.macroline thru 1.x.macroline at macro 1.y.macroline/mergeWhere x and y are the macro numbers (keep in mind that the new macrolines in the destination macro need to exist before you copy the source lines) ( those lines can be created by commandline as wel ( store macro 1.x. Macroline thru 1.x. Macroline

title: copy macro in a macro?
